Description: Tondo sherd of Attic red-figured pottery kylix with top of stem; interior: red-figure decoration consisting of the hydra (only one coiled snake and part of body remaining); exterior: black. Relief contour.
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Fitzwilliam Museum, Cambridge. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Bibliographic references: CVA Cambridge II / Corpus Vasorum Antiquorum: Great Britain, Fascicule 11, Cambridge, Fascicule 2 (p. 47, pl. XXVII, no. 2)
Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 514, no. C88)
Edgar 1898/1899 / Excavations at Naukratis. B: The Inscribed and Painted Pottery (p. 64, pl. VIII, no. 13)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.1498)
